means: 不相干的人所做的（或提供的）

sentence.Network_cn: 独立工党1893年1月13日在布拉德福德成立。

sentence.Network_cn: 如果俱乐部之间无法达成协议，将由一个独立的仲裁委员会来裁定。

derivation.yuyuan_name: early 17th cent. (as an adjective): partly on the pattern of French indépendant

entry.tran: 相互独立的;彼此不关联的
entry.def: If one thing or person is independent of another, they are separate and not connected, so the first one is not affected or influenced by the second.

example.ex: Your questions should be independent of each other...
example.tran: 你的问题应该彼此无关。

example.ex: We're going independent from the university and setting up our own group...
example.tran: 我们马上就将从大学分离出去,成立我们自己的团体。

entry.def: If someone is independent, they do not need help or money from anyone else.

example.ex: Phil was now much more independent of his parents...
example.tran: 菲尔现在不那么依赖父母了。

example.ex: She would like to be financially independent...
example.tran: 她希望在经济上能够自立。

entry.def: Independent countries and states are not ruled by other countries but have their own government.

example.ex: Papua New Guinea became independent from Australia in 1975.
example.tran: 巴布亚新几内亚 1975 年脱离澳大利亚正式独立。

entry.tran: (组织)独立的，不受他人控制的
entry.def: An independent organization or other body is one that controls its own finances and operations, rather than being controlled by someone else.

example.ex: ...the Office of Government Ethics, an independent agency.
example.tran: 政风处,一个独立的机构

entry.def: An independent school does not receive money from the government or local council, but from the fees paid by its students' parents or from charities.

example.ex: He taught chemistry at a leading independent school.
example.tran: 他在一所重点私立中学教化学。

entry.tran: (调查、意见)独立的，不偏不倚的
entry.def: An independent inquiry or opinion is one that involves people who are not connected with a particular situation, and should therefore be fair.

example.ex: The government ordered an independent inquiry into the affair...
example.tran: 政府下令对该事件进行独立调查。

example.ex: An independent opinion poll published today shows growing discontent with the government.
example.tran: 今天发表的一项独立民意测验表明民众对政府的不满正与日俱增。

entry.def: An independent politician is one who does not represent any political party.

example.ex: There's been a late surge of support for an independent candidate.
example.tran: 最近一位无党派候选人的支持率迅速上升。

example.ex: ...the most powerful independent politician in France.
example.tran: 法国最有影响力的无党派政治家

means.word_mean: 1. a neutral or uncommitted person (especially in politics)
2. a writer or artist who sells services to different employers without a long-term contract with any of them
1. free from external control and constraint;
2. not dependent on or conditioned by or relative to anything else
5. of a clause; able to stand alone syntactically as a complete sentence;

sentences.sentence: "the main (or independent) clause in a complex sentence has at least a subject and a verb"

means.word_mean: 6. not controlled by a party or interest group

auth_sentence.content: I have no future independent of being a carer.
auth_sentence.res_content: I have no future independent of being a carer.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: I have no future independent of being a carer.

auth_sentence.content: Being an independent state will help a great deal.
auth_sentence.res_content: Being an independent state will help a great deal.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: Being an independent state will help a great deal.

auth_sentence.content: 'Now' has no existence independent of the observer.
auth_sentence.res_content: 'Now' has no existence independent of the observer.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: 'Now' has no existence independent of the observer.

stems_affixes.type_exp: 1. =expend,表示"花费,支付"; 2. 最初意思为"称重量而衡量……",引申出花费,支付; 3. =hang,表示"悬挂"

stems_affixes.word_buile: depend[v.[on]取决于,依靠,信赖,相信]+able可以……的→adj.可依赖的

stems_affixes.value_cn: 依靠的,依赖的,从属的;随…而定的
stems_affixes.word_buile: depend[v.[on]取决于,依靠,信赖,相信]+ent……的→adj.依靠的,依赖的,从属的;随…而定的
im进入+pending即将发生的→adj.即将发生的,逼近的
in不+dependent[adj.依靠的,依赖的,从属的;随…而定的]→不依靠[别的人,事或物]
pend悬挂+ing正……的→悬挂之中→即将发生的
per全部+pend悬挂+ic+ular表形容词→全部挂着的→垂直的
append[v.附加,添加,悬挂]+ix表名词→n.附录,附属物;阑尾,盲肠
pend悬挂+ulum东西→挂着[摆动]的东西→钟摆
per全部+pend悬挂+ic+ular表形容词→全部挂着的→垂直的

stems_affixes.value_cn: 花费, 消耗, 用尽
stems_affixes.word_buile: s+pend花费,支付→v.花费, 消耗, 用尽 v.度过, 消磨
ap加强动作+pend悬挂→挂上去→悬挂
de下+pend悬挂→附属于另一物件
sus在……下面+pend挂→挂在下面→悬挂

Sentence.sentence: Most people would probably say that they want to be independent from imported oil.
Some independent thinkers have even produced cars that run on vegetable oil.
We have identified an independent role for memory for that meal,'" Brunstrom says

kd.EN: 可以说depend/dependence/dependent on 但只能说independent of

Sentence.sentence: The payroll survey also doesn't capture the number of self-employed, and so says little about how many people are generating an independent income.
And instead, I grew up believing that I was supposed to be totally independent and consequently became very reluctant to ask for help.

sentences.en: Children should be encouraged to be independent thinkers.
sentences.cn: 应该鼓励孩子独立思考。

means.word_mean: 不相关连的, 无关的

sentences.en: Judges must be independent of political pressure.
sentences.cn: 法官们一定不能受政治压力的影响。

jushi.english: She is a woman of independent means.
jushi.chinese: 她是个自力更生的妇女。

jushi.english: Children should be encouraged to be independent thinkers.
jushi.chinese: 应该鼓励孩子独立思考。

jushi.english: This is an objective law independent of human will.
jushi.chinese: 这是不以人的意志为转移的客观规律。
